comm: short of a length, slight movement, Ahmadi opens the face, gets a single to third man
movement away again, but starts a touch short and a touch wide. Left alone
too short again, and left alone again
and he goes for the big hooping inswinger that has Mangal surprised. It kisses the pad on the way and flies for four leg-byes
fuller outswinger finally. A touch too wide, and left alone
outswinger from wide on the crease, he opens the face on it as it is too short again. Gets a single to third man
he pitches up and draws a false shot right away. It is too wide, though, and Mangal can't reach it
edged but doesn't carry. Cross seam already, short of a length, holds its line, hits the shoulder of the defensive bat, but doesn't carry to first slip
moves across to cover the line outside off, and then leaves it alone
half-volley, off-driven, straight of mid-off, gets a single off the fumble
pitched up outside off, beats his drive. No swing on this
another edge as he throws his bat at a wide length ball, but the edge flies over third slip
wide half-volley, driven with an open face, to cover-point
lovely delivery. On a length, angling in, then leaving him a touch against that angle. Beats the edge
holds the line again, this time the edge is taken but it goes straight into the ground and through to third man for one
outswinger, on a length, outside off, left alone
inswinger, he sees it, and solidly behind it in defence
short of a length, outside off, opens the face on it, finds point
inswinger, but Ahmadi has picked it, and defends solidly again
short of a length, outside off, left alone
on a length, outside off, left alone
appeal for a catch at the wicket off the inside edge as this one jags back in. The ball beats the inside edge, but it has kissed the pocked on the way. Called not out
on a length, outside off, defended to cover
full, outside off, he is half-forward to defend it with an open face
short of a length, Mangal gets inside the line and bunts this onto the leg side for one
outswinger that starts a touch too short and a touch too wide. Left alone
fuller, from wide of the crease, just outside off, then swings against the angle. Well left
goes for the big big outswinger, starts too straight, concedes a wide outside leg
wide outswinger, easy to leave alone
short of a length, outside off, defended
short, just outside off, cut to point
drives at a wide outswinger. Is beaten
wide length ball, driven away from the body, finds the gap between point and cover-point
short of a length, just outside off, defended
draws the outside edge on a length ball, but the edge doesn't carry even though Jordan is standing quite close at third slip
full outswinger, a touch wide, draws a loose shot. Unlucky not to draw the edge
moves across to cover the line this time, but the drive finds square cover
short of a length this time, just outside off, defended
on a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
short, wide, cut away to third man for one
that's a nothing shot. This is short of a length, wide, moving away, Mangal just hangs his bat out horizontally. The edge is taken, and Root takes it overhead at first slip
and Anderson gives him the bouncer, higher than chest, lower than throat. Fended off. Bounce at SCG not too alarming
inswinger, too straight, turns it to the only man on the leg side, deep square leg
follows a wide outswinger. Can't reach it. Called wide
tries an outswinger too big, strays onto the pads, concedes a leg-bye
bouncer, a touch too short, easy to duck
on a length, he pushes at it away from the body, gets an inside edge back onto his body

Root in business again. A perfect length ball for a slightly loose batsman. Ahmadi drives at it away from the body, the ball moves away a touch, the edge is taken, and Root takes a simple catch at first slip
gets a bouncer first up, which he sways out of
short of a length, angling in, defended from the crease
pitches this up, outside off, left alone
on a length, outside off, defended
this is a beauty. Angled in, pitches just outside off, and then holds its line. Zazai plays the angle and is beaten
too full and too straight with the inswinger with an 8-1 field, which means he has to chase this towards mid-on himself
full and straight, nearly a yorker, kept out by Zazai
too full and too straight again, and Zazai clips this towards deep midwicket for two
short of a length, outside off, left alone
short of a length, outside off, left alone
digs this in shirt, he sways out of its line, and drops his wrists
defends a length ball outside off
another forward-defensive
full, outside off, defended off the forward
this time he gets some swing away, and beats a loose drive away from the body
outswinger, on a length, outside off, left alone
another outswinger, on a length, outside off, left alone
this one comes back in with the angle, and Zazai is alert. Defends this to mid-on
short of a length, angling in, tucked away off the hip
inswinger. Late movement too. Just short of a length, though. He has time to cover the movement. Defends from the crease
another inswinger, beats the inside edge this time, headed down leg, though
full, allows it to swing, takes a thick outside edge to point

and there he gets the wicket. Keeps pitching it up, just outside off, gets the ball to hold its line. It is on a length. Not quite a half-volley so the half-forward movement doesn't cover the movement. The regulation outside edge settles with Buttler
and yet another new batsman gets a bouncer first up. On middle and leg. Sami easily avoids it
on a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, angling in, bunted away for a single
wide length ball, left alone
short of a length, moves away outside off, gets good carry. Left alone
nice shot. Slightly on the walk as Anderson pitches short of a length. Punches this wide of mid-off for four. The first boundary of the innings
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
bouncer this time, quite quick, at the body. He ducks it
short of a length, just outside off, defended to cover. Not sure he got an extra cover to bowl short of a length
short of a length again, wide too, and Sami punches this square, between point and cover-point. AN ordinary over
on a length, just outside off, defended back to him
floats it up outside off again, and draws a loose drive by holding its line. Beats the outside edge
keeps the ball up, draws slight movement by holding its line outside off. Defended to mid-off
bouncer, too short, too high, called a wide
short of a length, outside off, defended
length ball, angling into the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, pretty straight, defended to mid-on
wide outswinger, driven away from the body, straight to point
more swing, pushed down to mid-off
he shimmies down the wicket to cover the swing, and defends this full ball back to Bopara
stays in the crease this time, fails to cover the movement as he drives. Beaten
short of a length, outside off, defended to point
short of a length, moves away a touch after starting outside off. Left alone

another wicket falls. Jordan keeps bowling at a length outside off. Sami drives hard at it. The ball holds its line, takes a thick edge square on the off side. Morgan takes a low catch diving forward at point
short of a length, angling in towards off, defended off the back foot
short again, rising towards the throat, fended off. Keeps it down
fuller this time, outside off, defended to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, defended with an open face
short of a length, outside off, moves across to cover the line and defend
short, on off, softly pulled to midwicket
short and wide, moving away a touch, beats the cut
full and wide outswinger, beats his drive
short of a length, outside off, opens the face, gets a single to third man
short of a length, holds its line, holds up a touch too. Defended after being squared up
sucker ball. Wide length ball, swinging away. Beaten
on a length, holding its line against the angle. Defended to cover
a touch too straight with the angle, dropped to leg for a single
wide length ball, defended off the front foot
on a length, outside off, the defensive shot trickles wide of mid-off for a single
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
short of a length, angling in, defended from the crease
full outswinger, a touch too full, squeezed past the second slip, along the ground
wide on the crease, angling in, defended to short midwicket
length ball outside off, defended to cover
full, swinging away a touch, defended off the outside half of the bat
full, into the pads, worked away past short midwicket for a couple
holds up a little, rears off a length and hits the higher half of the bat. Doesn't carry to short midwicket

the short ball gets a wicket this time. Not yet. Jamal has reviewed it immediately. Jamal comes down the wicket to cover the movement Jordan has been drawing, Jordan drags the length short, the ball gets a bit too big on him, and it goes under his left armpit. Umpire S Ravi thinks he has gloved it, but replays show there is daylight between ball and anything else. No deviation, no sound, not even close. Overturned
short of a length again, defended off the back foot
wide length ball, driven on the up, to cover
on a length, angling in, defended off the back foot
short of a length, outside off, he is on his toes as he defends
short of a length, wide, crunched away past cover for a four. Only the second boundary of the innings. Off the bat, that is
short of a length, outside off, double misfield at point and cover-point concedes a single
wide outswinger, left alone
another outswinger left alone
full and wide, driven past the man diving at cover for one
long hop, pulled away to deep square
on a length, holding its line outside off, defended to cover-point

full, swinging in, the mid-on is wide, and it has been pushed past that man for what looks like four. Morgan gives it good chase, but his arm - as he dives - touches the ball and the rope at the same time
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for a single
on a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
pushes in front of his body, defends this uppishly to cover
seams away from short of a length and outside off. Beats the outside edge
full, outside off, he moves across to cover the movement. Defends
offbreak, into the pads, worked away for a single
tossed up outside off, defended back to him
looks to work this to leg for a single. Played straight to short midwicket
defended back to him
flat offbreak, outside off, defended back to him
slows this one down, tosses it up outside off, defended to leg
bouncer, too short, and too high. Called a wide
floats this one up outside off, that is the length to bowl, and he beats a drive with the movement away
short of a length, good bounce, flies off the top half of the bat through gully for one
low full toss, has surprised Shafiq a little. Hit straight to mid-on
short of a length, he gets inside the line, and pulls it to fine leg for one
fuller, this one moves in with the angle, defended off the front foot, just outside off
stays full now, just outside off, no movement away, and defended well
looks to work this offbreak to leg, gets a legbye
tossed up outside off, gets some drift, pushed wide of short cover for one
flighted outside off, gets a good stride in and defends
quicker, flatter, pushed back to him
swept away hard to deep backward square for one
defended back to him
angling into the pads, nudged away for a single
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
short of a length again, runs this down to the third man for one

and a wicket immediately after the break. Just a gentle length ball outside off. Maybe it holds its line a touch but mostly a straight delivery. Jamal gets forward but not quite close to it. he also opens the face. Easy catch for Buttler
stays back to a length ball. Defends it to cover all right but he should have been forward to this
again stays back to a full ball and nearly edges it as it holds its line outside off
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
clipped to leg, but straight to short midwicket
flatter, he goes back to punch this past cover
slow through the air, flighted outside off, defended off the front foot
down the wicket already, makes room too, drives this to deep cover
short of a length, into the pads, worked around the corner for one
full, just outside off, pushed to mid-off
wide on the crease, gets this to move in, draws an inside edge, hits the pad
full, into the pads, he plays a pick-up shot over wide mid-on for four. Not quite sweetly timed, but the field is aggressive, and he has done enough to clear the infield
short of a length, just outside off, defended back to him
full and straight, pushed straight of mid-on, and he steals a single
length ball outside off, opens the face, guides it past point for one
flat offbreak, defended from the crease
lovely shot. The most authoritative of the day. Nabi skips down the wicket, also makes room, and lofts this over extra cover for a six. Excellent batting
flat, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, punched to mid-on
gets a single down the ground
slower ball, he has to delay the shot, and ends up bunting this into the leg side for one
another assertive shot from Nabi. Down the wicket again, and lofts this with an open face over cover. Lovely shot
short of a length, just outside off, pushed towards mid-on
slower ball, outside off, hits the high part of the bat. No run conceded as this trickles straight to point
slogs at a length ball angling in, and misses it. Plays down the wrong line. The ball sails over the stumps
half-volley on off, now he plays the more traditional drive along the ground. Gets a couple in front of deep cover
flat, speared into the pads, defended to leg
tossed up outside off, defended back to him
quicker again, he stays back and defends this outside off
slows this down a little, pushed to short straight midwicket
tossed up, nearly a yorker, worked into the leg side for a couple
flighted outside off, he moves across to cover the turn and defends
slower ball, middle and leg, worked around the corner for one
wide length ball, pushed to deep cover for another single
stays back to defend a length ball
soft dismissal. Nabi has taken it upon himself to provide some impetus to this innings. He has been taking risks in order to do so. Gets a short ball, pulls it hard, but straight down mid-on's throat
length ball outside off, tempting him to go after it. He leaves it alone
at the stumps now, defended from the crease
offbreak, pitches just outside off, defended to short midwicket
swept away to deep square leg
flat offbreak, just outside off, defended back to him
slower through the air, dips on him opens the face, gets a single to short third man

sharp offbreak, runs off the inside half of the bat, they call through for a second as deep square leg has to rush in. Zadran changes his direction while completing the second. If the throw touches him, he is gone obstructing the field
defended to cover
on a length, at the stumps, defended to mid-on
full, on off, defended from the crease
short of a length, pitched outside leg, concedes a run into the leg side
and there should have been a slip. Draws the outside edge but there is no slip to accept it. England not quite going for the kill
moves across the line to cover the line, Broad digs this in short and beats him behind him
wide length ball, pushed to deep cover for one
flat offbreak, punched to short straight midwicket
looks for the paddle sweep, Tredwell slows the ball down, beats him for pace
much quicker this time, just outside off, played back to Tredwell

Bopara is doing everything today. Shafiq tries the big sweep, gets a big top edge that flies around deep square leg. Bopara from fine leg and Jordan from deep midwicket converge, but nobody seems to have called for this. Jordan lets it go at the last moment, and Bopara takes it with a late dive to his left. Inches off the ground
swept away from middle and leg. Swept away crisply. Gets four for it through deep square leg
driven to long-off for one
full, on off, defended back to him
bouncer, a lot of effort, but it comes up loopily. Ducks under it
length ball, outside off, holds its line, beats the outside edge
short of a length outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
short of a length, outside off, holds its line, beats his tentative push

yorker, from wide on the crease. He keeps it out, the ball is nearly dead but he almost picks it up without the permission from the fielding side or the umpire. Stops himself, looks up at the bowler, and then picks it up
gentle loosener. Full, on off, at 127ks, and he has absolutely drilled it back over Jordan's head
bouncer, headed towards the throat. Zadran's head falls back as he fends. Manages to keep it down
short of a length, angling away, left alone
short of a length, quite rapid, 136ks, defended to mid-off

dropped by Najib Zadran. This is a length ball outside off, Hales goes hard at it, gets a thick edge that goes to the left of point. Najib dives, gets both hands to it, but spills it. Clear show of disappointment from bowler and captain. Najib has gone too hard at it, and has ended up grabbing at it
on a length again, pushed wide of mid-off for one
short of a length, angling away, Bell goes for the cut, is beaten
nicely driven away. Gets a length ball outside off, which he drives over the head of cover. No power, just timing
he starts with a bouncer, Hales hooks from outside off. Not in total control of it, but has got enough bat into the shot to clear the man at deep square leg
another bouncer. This one gets big on Hales who is late into the shot. The mis-hit clears that short mid-on, though
he stays short, and this is wide outside off. It is a good old long hop. Bell totally slams this pull through midwicket for four
short of a length, into the body, tucked away for a single
short of a length, just outside off, 139ks, defended with an open face
this one jumps at him from short of a length. Hales's head goes back as he defends this from the high part of the bat

length ball, outside off, he is early into the drive, fails to control it, but ends up chipping it over extra cover. A bit of a nothing shot. Not trying to keep it down, not going all out trying to hit it over the infield
short of a length, rising into the ribs, defended with his weight on his toes
wide half-volley, Bell goes low and drives it over square cover for four. Almost on a knee as he drives
length ball, outside off, Bell has pushed this to deep cover for one
a length ball outside off that seams away. Left alone
another leave outside off
on target first up, a length ball seaming in, takes the inside edge onto the pad
length ball outside off, played back to him off the inside half of the bat. This is a quick ball. Bell clearly late into the shot
floats this one up outside off. Pitches on a length, just outside off, Bell has to play, but then the ball holds its line against the angle to beat him
short of a length, outside off, looks to run this down to third man, but finds point
fuller, 144ks, this one moves back in, beats the inside edge but is headed down leg
wide full ball, Bell drives, gets a thick outside edge that avoids the fielder at point
low full toss, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, only slightly wide, Hales gets stuck into this. Punches it really hard. Beats short cover-point and also the man at deep cover

another drop. Action replay of the earlier drop. Once again a wide length ball, once again hard hands from Hales, another thick edge, and another failure on Najib's part to take a simple catch at point. Once again hard hands
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
this one moves away, against the angle, after pitching outside off. Left alone
short of a length, outside off, steered away for a single
short of a length, outside off, left alone
low full toss, pushed between mid-off and extra cover for a couple
full, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, just outside off, left alone
short of a length, wide, left alone
stays short of a length, no room, defended back to him
short of a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
Dawlat is short again, and chest high at his pace is not good enough. Pulled away for four to deep square leg
short again. Quicker. Good bouncer. Gets it higher too. Hales can't control the hook, but the top edge clears the wicketkeeper
short of a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
bouncer, this is straight and cramps him up. Hales has to duck it
the first time he has pitched up. The ball swings in, takes the inside edge onto the pad. No drama even though Dawlat has appealed vociferously for the lbw
beautiful bowling. Floats one up outside off, gets it to seam away after pitching. Beats the edge as Bell plays tentatively
yorker on off stump, at 143ks, kept out by Bell
angling in, beats the inside edge, hits him on the pad but is headed down leg. Mid-on dives all over this to allow the second
a half-volley, pushed straight of mid-on for two
short of a length, angling in, blocked back to him
steered away to third man for one
some turn first up, turns a bit too far, goes for two leg-byes
tossed up outside off, opens the face on it, gets a single to short third man
flighted, middle and leg, defended to leg
turn for Nabi from outside off to beat the inside edge. Possibly hitting him outside the line
full, on the pads, worked away for a single
plays with the turn, takes a single to wide of short fine leg
long hop, pulled from outside off, Hamid's misfield at mid-on turns one to two
short, wide, cut away, but straight to backward point
short again, pulled away again, Shafiq at deep midwicket misfields to allow them three extra runs

big appeal for lbw as Bell stays deep in the crease to a length ball. He plays for the turn, but it doesn't turn. Not given. Hawkeye shows it clipping leg. Awfully close. Looks worse than it actually is. And it is close enough anyway
short and wide, and he has picked out cover-point again
no timing on this cut but gets a single
tossed up outside off, defended off the front foot
down the wicket, beaten in flight, defended to midwicket
offbreak, middle and leg, worked to leg for one
shimmies down the wicket, not quite close to the pitch of the ball, pushes this to short midwicket
flat, punched down to long-on. Straight enough of the man to be able to come back for the second
tossed up outside off, defended back to him
nice legbreak, dipping on him, just outside off, defended with an open face
quicker flatter ball, Bell goes back and cuts, but finds backward point
tosses this up but offers a low full toss, which Bell drives wide of mid-on. Hamid Hassan comes around from deep midwicket, but slips during his slide, and lets this through for a four
long hop, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
uses the short boundary for a six. Just goes down on a knee and sweeps this length ball over deep square for a six
short, wide, cut away to deep cover for one
quick arm ball, but too full, and runs off the outside edge for a couple
tossed up, turning into the pads, defended to short midwicket
full, clipped off the toes for one
full, on off, turning in, turned to short midwicket
quicker ball, doesn't turn, Bell has to abort his attempt to play this to leg. Defends this back to him
too straight, helped around the corner for a single

short ball first up, hits the bat hard, but Bell has pulled this wide of mid-on for three. Dawlat and Shafiq, chasing the ball, leave it for each other, and Dawlat belatedly fields to allow them an extra run
slower ball, Hales checks his drive, and it lobs over cover

and Hassan gets a wicket on his final night of the World Cup. Something to cheer about at least. On a length, just outside off, seams away a touch. Hales is looking to defend, playing the angle, and ends up edging this through to the keeper
copybook forward-defensive to begin the innings
length ball, angling in, pushed wide of midwicket for a single
short of a length, swift, Bell makes a belated move to withdraw from the shot, and the ball hits the bat. He is lucky it has gone straight into the ground
offbreak, middle and leg, defended to midwicket
dipping on him, turns into him, beats the inside edge, hits the pad, but turning too far down leg
short of a length, outside off, defended to point
arm ball, a touch too full, driven to long-off
plays the lap shot to short fine leg for a single
another paddle, gets a single to fine leg
short of a length, quick, just outside off, Taylor is off his feet as he defends
length ball, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
angling too far into the pads, concedes a leg-bye
short of a length, outside off, off his feet to punch this to point
slower ball gone wrong, it is a wide down the leg side
plays the pull but Hassan is too quick, and he mis-times it to square leg
full, angling in, pushed straight of mid-on for a single
short of a length, angling in, chest high, Taylor is off his feet as he defends
shorter this time, Taylor goes deep in the crease to try to pull, and is beaten by the lack of bounce this time
short of a length, rising again, hits the shoulder of the bat, but this time they take a single to point
short of a length, wide, Bell looks to cut, top-edges it over slip
short of a length, angling in, Bell dabs this down to third man to get to another fifty. Now time for him to slow down as he usually does in ODI innings
short of a length, angling in, he gets behind it in defence
short of a length, outside off, Bell cuts. Beaten. Not short enough for the cut
on a length, shaping away, Bell plays with cement feet, gets an inside edge to long leg
short of a length, angling in, he has defended off the back foot
moves back and across and defends. A good Ashes audition going on
looks to cut, the ball is not wide enough, gets an edge fine of third man for a couple
looks to pull this from outside off, ends up playing it to mid-off
down the wicket to bunt this to midwicket for a single that ends the match
